item.title: Lichess: The Open Source Revolution in Chess
item.description:
Lichess: How the Open Source Community is Revolutionizing Chess

A deep dive into the world’s most popular open-source chess platform, its impact, and how you can be part of its future.

The Chess Revolution

In 2010, a programmer named Thibault Duplessis had a simple yet powerful vision: create a chess platform that would be completely free, open-source, and accessible to everyone. Today, that vision has evolved into Lichess (pronounced “lee-chess”), a platform that serves millions of players daily and hosts billions of games annually. The name itself reflects its technical roots: “lila” = lichess in Scala.

item.title: The Ultimate Guide to Chess Movies & Shows
item.description:
The Ultimate Guide to Chess in Cinema and Television

Chess, the timeless game of strategy and intellect, has long fascinated filmmakers and audiences around the world. From intense tournament showdowns to metaphoric battles reflecting life’s complexities, chess has served as both a central theme and a powerful symbol in cinema and television. Here’s an updated and curated list of must-watch chess-themed movies and TV shows that capture the drama, intensity, and beauty of the royal game.
